title: Is it okay to use iPhone while charging? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you think it’s bad, you have an incorrect understanding of how batteries work. This question has been asked and answered so many times it’s sad. So rather than repeat myself yet again, I’ll quote myself here: iPhones are designed to be used while charging. Apple doesn’t design products to fail when used as designed. Charging more often actually improves battery life as opposed to allowing the battery to drain significantly before charging it. So it’s best to charge as often as is convenient for you. Note: If you are worrying about when the battery will die, you’re doing it wrong. All batteries have limited lifespans and must eventually be replaced. The minute they leave the factory, they start degrading. Due to fluctuations in the mass production manufacturing process and differences in usage including environmental factors and usage patterns, some batteries age faster than others. Worrying about it changes nothing. Stop babysitting your battery. Just use and enjoy your iPhone. When the battery needs to be replaced, you’ll know it. When that time comes, for best results you should have it replaced with an authentic Apple battery by an Apple-authorized technician. Reference: David Blache's answer to Does attempting to use an iPhone at 100% and connected to the charger harm the battery lifespan?

Ideally, you shouldn’t be eating while you work. But you do, because you’re in some hurry. At the same time, you be careful that you do not spoil any of your work by spilling. Right? Similarly, you can use the iPhone while on charge, but make sure you’re not making direct contact to the phone, either by speaking over a call without earphones or by lying down with your head close to it. Technically there is a transfer of electic charges in and out of the phone which creates a magnetic as well as hear field and an energy involved in this process. Maybe your hands wouldn’t be much affected with it, but when you place it close to your head , there can be radiations striking parts of your brain, but of very small intensity though. When it becomes habitual and you continue speaking on phone while charging, some parts of your brain and heart could become prone to damage. So you can. But just be careful to stay away from it or just use it for texting/surfing the net. Calls over a earphones can be less harmful. Take care mate :)
